label: Description
value: On shaped, flaring foot a pyriform body with grouped vertical gadrooning. Spout attached to body and decorated with incised lines and relief bands. Hinged domed cover with tall finial. Wooden handle with spur attached with pegs.

label: Description
value: Circular bowl with baroque cartouche-shaped handles moulded with decoratve scrolls, the circular lid also decorated with spiral lambrequins and scrolls.

label: Description
value: Ecuelle (a): shallow bowl with reinforced rim and horizontal handles with scroll relief and slit. Lid (b): domed cover, upper part with conventionalized symmetrical relief decoration; edge reeded; flattened ring handle. Engraved shield with three cross on bend.

label: Description
value: Gadrooned spreading foot, baluster stem and rimless candle socket.

label: Description
value: Gadrooned foot, baluster stem and flaring candle holder.

label: Description
value: Flaring foot in one continuous line with gadrooned pyriform body, which has horizontal molding. Long, twisted, attached spout and double-scrolled strap handle. Dome, hinged cover.

label: Description
value: Pyriform body with vertical gadrooning and horizontal moldings. Curved spout, wide at bottom and narrow in upper part. Domed, hinged cover. Scrolled star handle with small spur.

label: Description
value: Light blue silk ribbon brocaded in a blue and white floral pattern comprised of a curvilinear floral vine that intersects with a slender vine of small leaves.

label: Description
value: Drug jar, decorated on one side in blue with figure of putto bearing a basket of fruit, within a framework of flowers and foliage.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. William G. Fitch in memory of her son, Clyde Fitch

label: Description
value: Peacocks on a balustrade with fruit and flowers.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: roller printed on plain weave

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. William D. Frismuth

label: Description
value: Pillar print with stylized Corinthian and Ionic capitals of flowers and leaves. An eagle in profile has a shield flag between outstretched wings.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: intaglio printed, monochrome

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. William D. Frismuth

label: Description
value: Chinoiserie pattern in blue on a cream colored ground. Two figures, one carrying a standard, mount a fantastical staircase toward a pagoda. Flowers and figures are in the style of French artist Jean-Baptiste Pillement.  Rococo style scrolls throughout. Bottom edge bound with white braid. Blue warps at each edge.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved plate on plain weave Label: cotton printed by engraved plate

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1911: Mrs. William D. Frismuth collection; 1911: acquired by the Museum.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. William D. Frismuth

label: Description
value: Rose satin ground with off-white weft patterning. Fragments show alternating vertical large-scale repeat vignettes of a horseman under attack by a leopard, a horseman with a raised scimitar fends off an attack by a lion, and a man standing before a large palm tree stabs a leopard. Men are dressed in a variety of Eastern costume.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: compound satin weave

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. James G. Goin

label: Description
value: Two roughly rectangular choir seats, each carved on undersurface, with shallow rests supported by: a stooped figure of a bearded man flanked by foliate roundels (-1a); head of a bearded man with flowing hair, flanked by foliate roundles (-1b); each seat with indentations for hinges on lower left and right.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Architectural League of New York

label: Description
value: Brisé fan of tortoise shell with gold silk ribbon. Sticks carved in low relief with an all-over design of small medallions. Guards elaborately carved in high relief with chinoiserie designs.

label: Physical description
value: Carved tortoise shell sticks, silk ribbon

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1912: Clarence Hoblitzelle; 1912: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Fan with ivory sticks and paper leaf. Leaf painted on front and back with scenes of Chinese life. Faces of figures are painted on small bits of applied ivory. Garments of figures are made of silk applied to the paper leaf. The ivory sticks are lace-carved with flowers, figures, etc. Guards are carved in high relief.

label: Physical description
value: Painted paper leaf, carved ivory sticks

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1912: Clarence Hoblitzelle; 1912: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Fan leaf with gilded and hand-colored lithographs showing genre scenes in the style of François Boucher within an elaborate setting of foliage and gothic architecture. Bone sticks and mother-of-pearl guards are carved and gilded.

label: Physical description
value: Paper leaf with gilded and hand-colored lithograph; carved bone sticks, mother-of-pearl guards

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1912: Clarence Hoblitzelle; 1912: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Brisé fan of carved ivory held with gold silk ribbon. Carved in lace-like fashion with houses, boats, figures. Guards similarly carved in very high relief.

label: Physical description
value: Carved and pierced ivory sticks, silk ribbon

label: Dimensions
value: H x W (open): 25.4 x 40.6 cm (10 x 16 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1912: Clarence Hoblitzelle; 1912: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Fan with lithograph showing a pastoral scene with musicians surrounded by gilded Rococo-style scrolls, mounted on pierced mother-of-pearl sticks; verso: flowers on a white ground.

label: Physical description
value: Paper leaf with gilded and hand-colored lithograph; carved and pierced mother-of-pearl sticks

label: Dimensions
value: H x W (open): 30.5 x 50.8 cm (12 x 20 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1912: Clarence Hoblitzelle collection; 1912: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Brisé fan of tortoise shell with green silk ribbon. Blades mostly plain with three carved panels. Guards carved in high relief.

label: Physical description
value: Carved tortoiseshell sticks, silk ribbon (probably replacement), tortoiseshell washer and metal loop at the rivet

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1912: Clarence Hoblitzelle; 1912: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: White damask with a pattern of symmetrically swinging broad bands with flowers and foliage enclosing central symmetrical group of flowers, grapes and wheat.

label: Description
value: Two fragments of white silk moire with brocaded design in shades of green, red, pink, and yellow. Symmetrical arrangement of floral sprays reversed on either side of central line.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary weft; moire
Study for "Searchlight, Harbor Entrance, Santiago de Cuba"

label: Description

value: Graphite, white chalk on gray paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.
Soldier Giving Water to a Wounded Companion

label: Description
value: Recto: Horizontal view of a soldier kneeling beside a wounded companion, holding his head, and giving him a drink from a canteen, as a third soldier stands and watches at left foreground. A faintly drawn group appears in right background. Verso: A drill ground.

label: Description
value:
Vertical view showing the heads of four soldiers, with color notation, "Blue", beside head, at center left; and an indistinct letter, at top.  

Verso:  various sketches of (1)a clouded sky, several "W's" inscribed at top; (2)a shore with boulders and vegetation emerging from the water, shown horizontally, with "Redish - white/ L[ight] B[lue]", the places to which are referred to being marked with circles and strokes, respectively, inscribed in the sky.
